_header: To London once my steps I bent

BLHar367.First Lines:
To london once my steppys I bentwhere trouth in no wyse should be
                    faynt…
BLHar367.Last Lines:
…Save london and send trew lawyers there medefor who so wantes
                    mony with them shall not spede
BLHar367.Note:
Rhyme royal. Folios out of order, so begins 127-127v and ends
                        126-126v.
BLHar367.Attributed Title:
London Lyckpeny: A ballade compyled by dan John Lydgate monke of Bery about
                    yeres agoe and now newly ouersene and amended (f. 127); Explicit London Lyckpeny
                    (f. 126v)

BLHar542.First Lines:
In london there I was lentI saw my selfe where trouthe shuld be a
                    teynte…
BLHar542.Last Lines:
…and they that be othar god theyr state restorefor he that
                    lackethe money with them he shall not spede
BLHar542.Note: 8-line stanzas. Written by the hand of John Stow.
BLHar542.Attributed Title: london licpenye (f. 102); explicit london likke peny (f. 104)
